humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that a total of 10 lymph nodes were examined, and metastatic carcinoma was found in 1 out of 2 sentinel lymph nodes and 1 out of 8 level 1 and II lymph nodes. This information corresponds to the N1 stage based on the AJCC staging system, as metastases are present in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (New Rule 12: N1).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for a cancer patient is determined by the presence and extent of lymph node metastasis. In this report, it is stated that 'Total number of lymph nodes examined: Ten. Total number of lymph nodes containing metastatic carcinoma by gross exam or light microscopy: Sentinel, 1/2; Level 1 and II, 1/8.' This indicates that metastatic carcinoma was found in one sentinel lymph node and one additional lymph node, but not in any other lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient would be N1.
